result.markdown:
# Grouped box plots {#sec-grouped-box-plots} ::: {.callout-note appearance='simple' icon=false} ***This graph should be readable but is currently undergoing final polishing.*** ::: :::: {.callout-note collapse="false" icon=false}
::: {.cell layout-align="right"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](grouped_box_plots_files/figure-html/full_code_display-1.png){fig-align='right' width=60% height=60%} ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.10em; color: #02577A;"} **This graph requires:** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.05em; color: #282b2d;"} **✅ a categorical variable** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.05em; color: #282b2d;"} **✅ a numeric (continuous) variable** ::: :::: ## Description Grouped box plots display five different statistical measures across a series of categories, or groups, of a discrete, ordinal, or interval variable. The five statistical measures are 1) the first quartile, 2) the second quartile, and 3) the third quartile. The fourth and fifth values are the largest/smallest values no further than 1.5 X inter-quartile range from the hinges. ## Set up ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **PACKAGES:** ::: Install packages. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} install.packages("palmerpenguins") library(palmerpenguins) library(ggplot2) ``` ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **DATA:** ::: ::: {.column-margin} ![Artwork by Allison Horst](www/lter_penguins.png){fig-align="right" width="100%" height="100%"} ::: Remove the missing `island` values from the `penguins` data. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} peng_box <- filter(penguins, !is.na(island)) glimpse(peng_box) #> Rows: 344 #> Columns: 8 #> $ species Adelie, Adelie, Adelie… #> $ island Torgersen, Torgersen, … #> $ bill_length_mm 39.1, 39.5, 40.3, NA, … #> $ bill_depth_mm 18.7, 17.4, 18.0, NA, … #> $ flipper_length_mm 181, 186, 195, NA, 193… #> $ body_mass_g 3750, 3800, 3250, NA, … #> $ sex male, female, female, … #> $ year 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007… ``` ::: ::: ## Grammar ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **CODE:** ::: - Create labels with `labs()` - Initialize the graph with `ggplot()` and provide `data` - Map `island` to the `x` axis and to `fill` - Map `bill_length_mm` to the `y` axis - Add `geom_boxplot()` and set the `alpha` to `2/3` - Remove the legend with `show.legend = FALSE` ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} labs_grp_boxplots <- labs( title = "Adult foraging penguins", subtitle = "Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica", x = "Island", fill = "Island", y = "Bill length (millimeters)") ggp2_grp_boxplots <- ggplot(data = peng_box, aes(x = island, y = bill_length_mm, fill = island)) + geom_boxplot(alpha = 2/3, show.legend = FALSE) ggp2_grp_boxplots + labs_grp_boxplots ``` ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **GRAPH:** ::: When a categorical variable is supplied, the plot will contain a box for each level or group. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell .column-page-inset-right layout-nrow="1"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](grouped_box_plots_files/figure-html/create_graph_grp_boxplots-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: ::: ## More info ### Notches Add notches to the box plot using the `notch = TRUE` and `notchwidth` arguments. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell .column-page-inset-right layout-nrow="1"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggp2_grp_box_notch <- ggplot(data = peng_box, aes(x = island, y = bill_length_mm, fill = island)) + geom_boxplot( notch = TRUE, notchwidth = 0.85, alpha = 2/3, show.legend = FALSE) ggp2_grp_box_notch + labs_grp_boxplots ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](grouped_box_plots_files/figure-html/notches_boxplots-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: ::: ### Outliers Box plots display outliers using points, and we can change the color these using the `outlier.colour` argument. Inside the `geom_boxplot()`, we map `island` to `color` and set `outlier.colour` to `NULL`: ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell .column-page-inset-right layout-nrow="1"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggp2_grp_box_outliers <- ggplot(data = peng_box, aes(x = island, y = bill_length_mm, fill = island)) + geom_boxplot(aes(color = island), outlier.colour = NULL, outlier.size = 2, notch = TRUE, notchwidth = 0.85, alpha = 2/3, show.legend = FALSE) ggp2_grp_box_outliers + labs_grp_boxplots ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](grouped_box_plots_files/figure-html/outliers_boxplots-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: :::
